mayankvarmaa: "Delhi as a centre of power is an inheritance, a historical habit. An unbearable consequence of this is the proximity of easy funds for various alleged intellectual pursuits which has enabled it to appropriate the status of intellectual centre. It is a scholarship city, a city of think tanks, of men who deal in discourse, debates and policies. And of fake serious women who wear the sari the other way and become leftists, nature lovers and diurnal feminists." An excerpt from Manu Joseph's "Why Bombay hates Delhi" I am new to this city, but still I feel this is the most relatable piece of literature that describes Delhi perfectly from a critical point of view (Or say a Journalist's point of view) Come to Delhi, the media capital needs people like you.
